channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Two storey building in garden. Doubt has planning permission.

item.title: Road Danger, 5th June
item.description:
The road outside our house is dual carriageway and the centre reservation is so overgrown it is very dangerous in your car and you cannot see cars coming from the left or your right when returning, it badly needs cutting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A38, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed wall debris on pavement, 5th June
item.description:
Bricks & stone copings from collapsed boundary wall on pavement in Queens Road - outside no.'s 66 & 68. Been there for months - no sign of anybody removing debris or sorting out wall, more of which looks like it might collapse too. Needs to be cleared up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 66 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins & recycling boxes permanently on pavement, 5th June
item.description:
Bins & recycling boxes permanently live on pavement in Glencairn Park Road, just around the corner from Queens Road. Outside no. 68 Queens Road (door on side, in Glencairn Park Road). Bins numbered 68A and 68B. Should not live on pavement - need to be located onto private property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 68a Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Adandoned roadworks sign, 5th June
item.description:
There is a random seemingly-abandoned / dumped roadworks sign on Queens Road, adjacent to the rubbish bin by the junction with Kensington Avenue. Sign has been there for weeks - no roadworks in area recently, so why it's there is anybody's guess. Needs removing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 82 Queen's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unnecessary traffic lights causing delays, 4th June
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights on Shurdington Road are causing huge delays. The timing of them is completely off, meaning tail backs in to Cheltenham and Gloucester. If the third exit to Endsleigh Insurance was timed shorter than those on the actual road, there wouldn't be a problem as hardly any traffic is coming out of there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Tynings Shurdington Road, Shurdington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead hedgehog on pavement, 3rd June
item.description:
Please can a dead hedgehog be removed from the pavement right outside of the Village Mews flats and opposite the New Dawn homes. It’s a large hedgehog and has been there for days in the heat. It has upset children as it is right on the pavement and must be a health and safety risk because it will soon have maggots.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Village Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 3rd June

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Elkstone
